Restrictions on elderly and nursing homes: "the departures of residents are restricted to once a week, which must be done with a single family member and with a maximum duration of two hours. During these outings it will not be possible to have a meal outside or to go to spaces with a high concurrence of people. Visits by relatives to users of assisted living facilities are permitted in accordance with exceptional measures."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200716090024/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11716-el-govern-decreta-l-us-obligatori-de-mascaretes-com-a-mesura-preventiva-davant-la-covid-19

The Government of Argentina has announced the extension of quarantine and social distancing measures. The following areas will remain in quarantine (“aislamiento social”) through at least October 11: the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area; in addition to those places forming part of the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area, the departments of General Pueyrredón, Bahía Blanca, and Tandil in Buenos Aires Province; the Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Susques, Yavi, Rinconada, and San Pedro departments of Jujuy; the Capital department of La Rioja; the Bariloche and Dina Huapi metropolitan areas and the General Roca department of Río Negro; the General José de San Martín, Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, General Güemes, La Caldera, Orán, and Capital departments of Salta; the Río Gallegos metropolitan area in Santa Cruz; the Capital and Banda departments of Santiago del Estero; and the Río Grande department of Tierra del Fuego. Per the latest order, most of the rest of the country remains in mandatory social distancing. Even in those provinces under mandatory social distancing, strict limits on travel, gatherings, and other activities apply. Media reports indicate that this period may be extended with some modifications; this has yet to be confirmed.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

On the 4th August 2020, the Bangladeshi government announced that it would be extending domestic restrictions to control the spread of COVID-19. The provisional deadline for the extension is the 31st August. This included the announcement that "residents must wear masks when in public and stay home to the extent possible." This is in addition to the continuing colour-coded classification system, wherein stricter regulations were imposed on areas of high COVID-19 levels within Bangladesh. In some cases this includes stricter regulations regarding staying at home, up to the level that staying home is required, but with exceptions.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200807090705/https://www.worldaware.com/covid-19-alert-bangladesh-extends-modified-domestic-restrictions-through-aug-31

From Ministry of Health  "Dr. Al-Zayani also calls for the application of all the instructions, instructions and precautionary measures issued by the National Medical Team to address the Coronavirus (Covid 19), such as leaving the house only for necessity"   "Leaving the house only for necessity" could be potentially be interpreted here as a recommendation or requirement.  However, when considered in light of previous entry of 17th Sept, in which the stay at home measure was a noted to be a requirement, and given the latest message reiterates the importance of following existing measures,  conclusion is that the "requirement" criteria has been met.  Hence C6 = 2G.    Source: http://archive.today/2020.10.08-124148/https://www.moh.gov.bh/News/Details/4450

Effective on 22 June 2020 "the recommendation to work from home and specific requirements for protecting people at especially high risk have been lifted."    Based on this, it seems cleanest to also change C6 to 0 on 22 June 2020.    However:  The German-language "recommendations" already dropped the recommendation to stay at home on or before 17 June (http://web.archive.org/web/20200617130505/https://www.bag.admin.ch/bag/de/home/krankheiten/ausbrueche-epidemien-pandemien/aktuelle-ausbrueche-epidemien/novel-cov/empfehlungen-fuer-den-alltag.html) but after 6 June (see that entry).    WARNING: the English language version of "New coronavirus: Recommendations for everyday life" at the Federal Office of Public Health FOPH keeps stating "That's why we should generally still stay at home."  In this inconsistency between the English-language and the German/French/Italian-language version, it is taken that the German/French/Italian versions are the authoritative ones!  So DO NOT rely on the English version for this topic.

stayhome-Notes: On Monday, September 14, authorities lifted the national state of emergency initially declared in March in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Lockdown restrictions, including a nightly curfew, in place to curb the spread of COVID-19, were also lifted. The prohibition of private meetings will no longer be in force.     The COE recalled that neither national nor local authorities may restrict free movement and association.    Individuals will continue to be required to wear face masks in public areas, and to comply with social distancing measures (maintain a 2m (6ft) distance) and practise frequent hand washing. On the 22nd of September, the British government, in the grip of a second wave of coronavirus,  told the nation’s workers to work from home if they could, a policy reversal that forced banks and other employers to readjust their corporate policies on the fly.  “We are once again asking office workers who can work from home to do so,” Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Tuesday, adding that Britain had reached “a perilous turning point” as nearly 5,000 new coronavirus cases were reported the same day.  Scottish, Northern Ireland, and Wales governments all were advising that where possible, people should work from home prior (hence 0 is likely wrong for previous codings as the change coding to 0 was referring to the Leicester case and ignored Scottish advise that originally prompted the 1T coding).   https://web.archive.org/web/20201004232124/https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/09/22/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus  https://www.instituteforgovernment.org.uk/explainers/coronavirus-lockdown-rules-four-nations-uk (not archivable, summary for Scotland/Wales/NI governments)

There is a curfew, and specific times that people can go out and do things based on their identification numbers. This ruling has been extended several times. Most recently, it has was extended until October 18th.    "Honduran authorities have extended the nationwide daily curfew until 23:00 (local time) on Sunday, October 18, due to the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. Members of the public are permitted to leave their homes to undertake essential activities on selected days based on the last digit of their national identity card or passport number of non-Honduran citizens between 06:00 and 20:00 (local time):    Oct. 12: The last digit is 2 and 3  Oct. 13: The last digit is 4 and 5  Oct. 14: The last digit is 6 and 7  Oct. 15: The last digit is 8 and 9  Oct. 16: The last digit is 0 and 1  Oct. 17: The last digit is 2 and 3  Oct. 18: The last digit is 4 and 5  There are a few exceptions for those working in emergency services and essential workers, who are allowed to go out on additional days. Additionally, persons with disabilities, senior citizens, and pregnant women will be granted special access to commercial establishments between 07:00 and 09:00, and banks between 09:00 and 10:00."    Below are links to each extension:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201014005539/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/381356/honduras-authorities-extend-covid-19-restrictions-through-october-4-update-20    https://web.archive.org/web/20201014005550/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/386126/honduras-authorities-extend-covid-19-restrictions-until-october-11-update-21    https://web.archive.org/web/20201014005636/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/388386/honduras-authorities-extend-covid-19-curfew-and-movement-restrictions-until-october-18-update-22

The corona cabinet is expected to meet on Tuesday to discuss relaxing lockdown measures. However, nothing is expected to change until Sunday.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201011140051/https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/coronavirus-israel-readies-for-first-steps-toward-exiting-lockdown-645271    Israel announced a 3 week national lockdown effective 18 September from 14:00 until 11 October 2020. stayhome-Notes: [the three-day drill ended on 7 May] https://web.archive.org/web/20200511150059/https://thediplomat.com/2020/05/practice-makes-perfect-mongolias-covid-19-outbreak-drill/ “the Mongolian government conducted a three-day drill to check the response and coordination between 14 local and national organizations during a simulated COVID-19 outbreak. The drill started on May 5 with a hypothetical scenario, during which a routine test of the local population revealed three people in the Chingeltei district to be infected with COVID-19.” “The drill started on May 5 with a hypothetical scenario, during which a routine test of the local population revealed three people in the Chingeltei district to be infected with COVID-19. The next day, on May 6, local law enforcement together with doctors started to check all the people who were in direct contact with the three sick patients. During the investigation it was revealed that hundreds of people had become sick (again, for the purposes of the simulated drill scenario). Phase two of the drill started with cordoning off the whole Chingeltei district to stop the spread of the virus to other parts of the city. During the exercise, all citizens were urged to not go outside unless required for medical reasons. Three medical facilities were set up to specifically deal with simulated COVID-19 patients.”

Press statements by Prime Minister Ludovic Orban:    Dear Romanians, I felt it is my obligation to make today this statement. Today we registered the largest single-day COVID-19 caseload - 555 Romanians who were declared positive after being diagnosed. Over the last four weeks, we registered an increase in the number of cases from week to week.    Unlike other countries, in Romania, the Government I am leading, had an approach of the gradual relaxation measures, with restrictions lifting phases, relaxation measures phases, once with opening the activities that have been under restriction in various phases, following increased interaction between people, we witnessed an increase in the number of cases from week to week.  I conclude by conveying a message to every Romanian: The virus does not forgive anyone, nor does it forgive those who do not believe in the existence of the virus. If someone overlooks the rules, neglects and exposes himself to illness, when he becomes ill he not only endangers himself, he also endangers his loved ones, family members, relatives, colleagues, and friends.    When you get sick you risk getting your loved ones sick as you may transmit the virus to those you are most often in close contact with. If you don't care about your health and you don't believe in this virus or you think this virus is not dangerous, please care about your brother, your mother, your father, your child, your friends, your colleagues. Only together, in solidarity and respecting simple rules, established by specialists, those who know very well how to fight against this virus, only together can we bring things back to normal and fight the epidemic effectively. I am confident that every Romanian will understand this watershed moment and will understand that success in the fight against the epidemic will solely depend on responsible and correct behaviour towards fellow citizens. Thank you!    Link: http://archive.vn/S8uM1

stayhome-Notes: On July 22, the government extended the country's "adaptive quarantine" until August 31, and  announced the introduction of enhanced monitoring and public health measures to regulate quarantine restrictions in different parts of the country. Green, yellow, orange and red levels of risk  have been assigned at the regional and sub-regional level and according to localised public health  data. These colour-coded levels inform COVID-19 quarantine restrictions in different regions and subregions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200814005407/https://www.oecd.org/eurasia/competitiveness-programme/eastern-partners/COVID-19-CRISIS-IN-UKRAINE.pdf
No evidence of stay-at-home requirements in effect. Recommendations (e.g. in Arizona) continue to advise limiting movements.

Note: There is still no curfew in place and very few restrictions on intercity or interstate travel. See: https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [accessed 5 October 2020, web archive unavailable]

It seems like there are measures in place: authorities across Yemen have introduced a range of measures. These include curfews, movement restrictions. However, some governorates started lifting the curfew but precautionary measures remain in place. See: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19; also, https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/yemen/coronavirus [accessed 12 October 2020, web archive unavailable]

The Government of Zimbabwe has declared a lockdown over COVID-19 and everyone is required to stay at home.   Staying at home means:    You only go outside for food and health reasons (as you can work from home)  If you go out, stay at least a metre away from other people at all times  Wash your hands as soon as you get home  Do not meet/ visit others, even friends or family.  http://www.mohcc.gov.zw/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=252:stay-at-home-stay-safe-defeat-covid-19&catid=103&Itemid=743    People are not complying with the regulations:  https://www.thezimbabwemail.com/health/progress-against-virus-brings-complacency-in-parts-of-africa/
stayhome-value: require not leaving house except for essentials

stayhome-Notes: "An overnight curfew prohibiting the movement of people outside their place of residence between the hours of 10.30 pm and 5 am is in place in the municipalities of Pristina, Prizren, Peja, Podujeva, Gjakova, Ferizaj, Lipjan, Drenas, Vushtrri, South Mitrovica, Gjilan, Fushe Kosove and Sterpce. In those municipalities, individuals over 65 years of age, or with chronic illnesses are only permitted to leave their place of residence between the hours of 5 am to 10 am and 6 pm to 9pm."    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200921224255/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kosovo/coronavirus
